clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Patients Suffering From Nervous Restlessness With PASCOFLAIR®
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Patients Suffering From Nervous Restlessness With PASCOFLAIR®

collaborator.agency: Institut für Empirische Gesundheitsökonomie, Prof. Dr. Dr.med. Reinhard Rychlik,Am Ziegelfeld 28,51399 Burscheid,Germany

brief_summary.textblock: The study was carried out as a prospective, non-interventional study with the intention of subsequent process cost analyses (PCA) and also considers quality of life, drug misuse, dependence, adverse events and therapy satisfaction.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study was carried out as a prospective, non-interventional study with the intention of subsequent process cost analyses (PCA) and also considers quality of life, drug misuse, dependence, adverse events and therapy satisfaction. Data were collected in collaboration with 22 physicians in Germany.
The study was designed as a one armed non-interventional study. Patients had to suffer from nervous restlessness in order to be eligible for study documentation. Participants agreed to a medical treatment with PASCOFLAIR® of 12 weeks. In this context, documented patients could take PASCOFLAIR® at the first time or could have started within the past three months before the initial visit. Furthermore, documented patients had to be older than 18 years and must be able to read and understand the patient declaration of data protection and the declaration of consent. The patient must not be an alcoholic, must not be drug dependent and have no other types of addiction. Patients who were pregnant or breast-feeding were not eligible for study participation. Furthermore, patients showing hypersensitivity against passionflower extract or against other components of the medication were excluded. The signed declaration of consent of participating patients is available.
The treatment of affected patients may not be documented, if a redemption (written or spoken) of the declaration of consent is existing or the patient takes Benzodiazepines.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Symptom Inner Restlessness (Pre - Post)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
primary_outcome.description: Symptom was assessed in a Likert scale ranging from 0 "no symptoms at all" to 10 "very severe symptoms"

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Symptom Sleep Disturbance (Pre - Post)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom was assessed in a Likert scale ranging from 0 "no symptoms at all" to 10 "very severe symptoms"

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom was assessed in a Likert scale ranging from 0 "no symptoms at all" to 10 "very severe symptoms"

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom was assessed in a Likert scale ranging from 0 "no symptoms at all" to 10 "very severe symptoms"

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Symptom Lack of Concentration (Pre - Post)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom was assessed in a Likert scale ranging from 0 "no symptoms at all" to 10 "very severe symptoms"

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline )
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom was assessed in a Likert scale ranging from 0 "no symptoms at all" to 10 "very severe symptoms"

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation-approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom was assessed in a Likert scale ranging from 0 "no symptoms at all" to 10 "very severe symptoms"

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation - approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom was assessed in a Likert scale ranging from 0 "no symptoms at all" to 10 "very severe symptoms"

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom was assessed in a Likert scale ranging from 0 "no symptoms at all" to 10 "very severe symptoms"

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from visit 2 (approx. 4 weeks after baseline) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: The Benzodiazepine Dependence Questionnaire (BDEPQ) is a 30 item self report questionnaire designed to measure dependence on benzodiazepine tranquilisers, sedatives and hypnotics. Items cover all aspects of the dependence syndrome with the exception of withdrawal symptoms. Each item is rated on a four point likert scale referring to experiences in the last month. BDEPQ score ranges from 0 (no dependence) to 85 (most severe dependence).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: RS-13 is a 13 items self Report questionnaire measure the resilience, which applies a reliance scale ranging from 13 (lowest stress resistance) to 91 (highest stress resistance).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in EQ-5D (Health Questionnaire) Scores (Pre - Post)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D™ is a standardised instrument for use as a measure of health Outcome The EQ-5D assesses five aspects of QoL: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. An EQ-5D profile score of 0 points represents the worst QoL (death), while 1 point stands for full health. Data analysis was performed according to the EuroQol manual. The EQ-VAS ranges from 0 (worst QoL) to 100 (best QoL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of EQ-5D VAS Scores (Pre - Post)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: VAS values (Quality of Life) range from 0 (very poor) to 100 (best possible state).

secondary_outcome.measure: Tolerability Assess Using a 5 Point Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of Tolerability on visit 3 (appr. 12 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of tolerability using a 5 point scale (very good, good, satisfactory, bad, very bad)

study_pop.textblock: Patients had to suffer from nervous restlessness in order to be eligible for study documentation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients suffering from nervous restlessness
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18 years and must be able to read and understand the patient declaration of data protection and the declaration of consent
- alcoholics, drug pending, addictive disorder
- pregnancy or lactating
- patients showing hypersensitivity against passionflower extract or against other components of the medication

group.title: PASCOFLAIR Group (Verum)
group.description: Patients who were treated with PASCOFLAIR

baseline.population: A total of 156 patients participated in the study. Two patients were excluded from the analysis, because they received Benzodiazepines (Tavor, Lexostad). One patient was 17 years of age when documented in the study. The overall study population considered in the analyses was 154 patients.

group.title: PASCOFLAIR Group (Verum)
group.description: Patients who were treated with PASCOFLAIR

outcome.title: Change of Symptom Inner Restlessness (Pre - Post)
outcome.description: Symptom was assessed in a Likert scale ranging from 0 “no symptoms at all” to 10 “very severe symptoms”
outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
outcome.population: If a symptom was rated 0, it was considered nonexistent. For any other rating (1 to 10) the symptom was considered existent. Only 146 patients showed this symptom.

outcome.title: Change of BDEPQ (Benzodiazepine Dependence Questionnaire)
outcome.description: The Benzodiazepine Dependence Questionnaire (BDEPQ) is a 30 item self report questionnaire designed to measure dependence on benzodiazepine tranquilisers, sedatives and hypnotics. Items cover all aspects of the dependence syndrome with the exception of withdrawal symptoms. Each item is rated on a four point likert scale referring to experiences in the last month. BDEPQ score ranges from 0 (no dependence) to 85 (most severe dependence).
outcome.time_frame: Change from visit 2 (approx. 4 weeks after baseline) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)
outcome.population: For patient with less than 75% items answered the BDEPQ-Score was not calculated. For only 132 patients Score was calculated.

group.title: PASCOFLAIR Group (Verum)
group.description: Patients who were treated with PASCOFLAIR

measure.title: Change of BDEPQ (Benzodiazepine Dependence Questionnaire)
measure.description: The Benzodiazepine Dependence Questionnaire (BDEPQ) is a 30 item self report questionnaire designed to measure dependence on benzodiazepine tranquilisers, sedatives and hypnotics. Items cover all aspects of the dependence syndrome with the exception of withdrawal symptoms. Each item is rated on a four point likert scale referring to experiences in the last month. BDEPQ score ranges from 0 (no dependence) to 85 (most severe dependence).
measure.population: For patient with less than 75% items answered the BDEPQ-Score was not calculated. For only 132 patients Score was calculated.

outcome.title: Change of RS-13 (Resilience Questionnaire) (Pre - Post)
outcome.description: RS-13 is a 13 items self Report questionnaire measure the resilience, which applies a reliance scale ranging from 13 (lowest stress resistance) to 91 (highest stress resistance).
outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment; week 0) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)

outcome.title: Change in EQ-5D (Health Questionnaire) Scores (Pre - Post)
outcome.description: EQ-5D™ is a standardised instrument for use as a measure of health Outcome The EQ-5D assesses five aspects of QoL: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. An EQ-5D profile score of 0 points represents the worst QoL (death), while 1 point stands for full health. Data analysis was performed according to the EuroQol manual. The EQ-VAS ranges from 0 (worst QoL) to 100 (best QoL).
outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (before treatment) to last visit (end of observation- approx. 12 weeks after baseline)

An EQ-5D profile score of 0 points represents the worst QoL (death), while 1 point stands for full health. Data analysis was performed according to the EuroQol manual. The EQ-VAS ranges from 0 (worst QoL) to 100 (best QoL).

reported_events.time_frame: The observational period was from September 2014 till June 2015. Per Patient were adrs collected for the treatment period (12 weeks).

group.title: PASCOFLAIR Group (Verum)
group.description: Patients who were treated with PASCOFLAIR

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
